citation.article-title: Geobacillus galactosidasius sp. nov., a new thermophilic galactosidase-producing bacterium isolated from compost

p.s: Description of Geobacillus galactosidasius sp. nov.

id="par0080">Geobacillus galactosidasius (ga.lac.to.si.da'si.us. N.L. n. galactosidasum, galactosidase; L. suff. -ius -ia -ium, suffix used in adjectives pertaining to galactosidase; N.L. masc. adj. galactosidasius, pertaining to galactosidase because this microorganism has good galactosidase activity).
id="par0085">Cells are aerobic, Gram-positive, motile, spore-forming rods producing white colonies, regular in shape with irregular edges.
Optimal growth occurs at pH 7.2 (range 6–8) and 70 °C (range 50–75 °C).

The strain is positive for catalase, oxidase, tyrosine decomposition, hippurate hydrolysis, nitrate and nitrite reduction, and negative with respect to casein hydrolysis, starch hydrolysis, gelatine hydrolysis and phenylalanine deamination.
The strain is not sensitive to lysozyme activity.
Good growth is obtained on galactose, raffinose, sucrose, cellobiose, xylose, lactose, sodium acetate, n-decane and n-pentadecane.

Bacitracin (10 μg), gentamicin (30 μg), novobiocin (30 μg), tetracycline (30–50 μg), penicillin G (2 U), kanamycin (30 μg), ampicillin (25 μg), lincomycin (15 μg), erythromycin (30 μg), neomycin (30 μg) and vancomycin (30 μg) sensitive.

MK7 is the most abundant menaquinone and the predominant polar lipids are 1,2 diacylglycero-3-phosphorylethanolamine, 1,3-bis(sn-3′-phosphatidyl)-sn-glycerol, phosphatidylserine, phosphatidylglycerol, whereas isoC15:0, isoC17:0 and anteisoC17:0 are the major fatty acids.
id="par0090">Type strain CF1BT (= DSM 18751T = ATCC BAA-1450T) was isolated from compost at the “Experimental System of Composting” (Teora, Avellino, Italy).
The DNA G + C content of the type strain is 53.5 mol% (additional strain CF1R is 53.8 mol%).
The EMBL accession number for the 16S rDNA sequence of CF1BT is AM408559.
